meanings.definition: the belief that Jesus was adopted as the Son of God at his baptism
meanings.sent1: In adoptionism, Jesus became the Son of God when he was baptized.
meanings.sent2: The early Christians debated the concept of adoptionism.
meanings.sent3: At the theological conference, they joked about baptism turning into adoptionism.
meanings.sent4: The idea of adoptionism can be seen as a spiritual transformation.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of adoptionism made it appealing to some believers.

meanings.definition: the theological doctrine that Jesus was not divine by nature but was adopted as the Son of God at some point in his life
meanings.sent1: Some theologians argue for the validity of adoptionism in Christianity.
meanings.sent2: The debate over adoptionism led to divisions within the church.
meanings.sent3: The humorous play depicted Jesus experiencing adoptionism in a comedic light.
meanings.sent4: The metaphorical journey of adoptionism challenges traditional beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The vivid imagery of adoptionism as a process of divine selection is thought-provoking.
